CatDescriptText: Julius Wright, 111 Yanshire Road, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 5, 1957, pg. 2 with question: "Should ministers take an active part in politics? Do you believe that they should hold public office?" answer reads: "My opinion as to whether or not a minister should be active in politics tells me that this should be left up to the minister.  If he feels like he should...he should.  If he feels like me, he should be in politics as much as anybody else."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Julius Wright wearing dark tie and striped coveralls, standing in front of car, with building with fire escape in background
